author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 256 brandy bottles worth Rs. 23,896 and Rs. 10,000 were stolen from a Tasmac outlet at the Kunjipalayam Junction at Jamin Uthukuli, Pollachi, on Sunday. The incident came to light when supervisor of the shop S. Saravanakumar (34) opened the shop on Monday.

Two attacked

Three persons have attacked K. Vinodkumar (33) of Poosariupalayam, and his sister using a sickle. The police said that they attacked Vinod when he asked Gowtham, Dinesh and Prasanth, who were standing on the middle of the road, to give way for his two-wheeler to pass. Vinod’s sister who lives nearby suffered an injury on her head when she tried to protect her brother.

Case registered

More than three years after a gold chain weighing about 28 gm was snatched away from a five-year-old girl, the police on Monday registered a case against an unidentified person.

The incident occurred when girl and her mother S. Shanthini Begam (35) of Mullai Nagar in, Podanur, had gone to Sangamam marriage hall on the Podanur road to attend a marriage on July 1, 2012.

Jewellery stolen

Gold jewellery weighing about 120 gm kept in a bag of K. Ganesha Narayanan (66) of Renga Nagar in Trichy was reportedly stolen from a marriage hall at Ram Nagar, on February 5.

Cheating case

The police have registered a case against four for allegedly trying to dupe J. Kotteeswaran (41) of Chinniyampalayam, by trying to sell brass bars as gold. The accused were: V. Ramesh (37), wife R. Gnagammal (27), V. Nagaraj (24) and M. Kottesh (58).

Sexual harassment

M. Saiman (24) of Alamelu Mangammal Layout in Ammankulam was arrested on Monday for sexually harassing a 38-year-old woman of the same locality.
title: Tasmac outlet burgled
